cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

This paper deals with the problem of private summation, which is a common topic in the cryptography and data structures subfields of computer science. The use of the shuffle model and its variants also suggests a focus on privacy-preserving protocols and algorithms, which are often studied in the security and information theory subfields. Additionally, the paper involves communication complexity and trade-offs, which are relevant to the algorithms and complexity theory subfields. Therefore, the most likely categories are cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
